Reviews.Title: “A Good Bed For The Night”
Reviews.Author: Martin D
Reviews.Content: Remember this is a budget hotel and Amsterdam is an expensive city - you get what you pay for. Room was very basic, though we did request a first floor room (and got it). Could hear the people above 'moving furniture'! We were a bit disappointed initially to find the bed was really saggy with springs that made sleeping uncomfortable. To her credit, the Irish owner Clodagh was very grateful to us for bringing this to her attention and promised to replace it as soon as possible, which she did. She left a beautiful vase of tulips in the room to say sorry. Making up the room was forgotten on several occasions. Take your own shower gel as this is not provided (would it cost much to include this?). Breakfast was plentiful in buffet style - salami, boiled eggs, cheese, ham, breads, fruit juice, tea, coffee, fresh fruit, in a pleasant airy room. Staff were wonderfully courteous and helpful. We both felt safe in the hotel and the district in which it was situated. Tram 1 to town and central station stops right outside station - very handy. Best buy is a 24 hr ticket 7.50 Euro (can also get a 48 hr version). Supermarket under hotel very useful as others have pointed out. Would recommend it if a budget hotel is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: BucharestAndreea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Abba Hotel for 4 nights, in early April 2012. We had a basic double room with ensuite bathroom. The room was not too small, the sink was in the room, we had a large window. Breakfast was good (ham and cheese, tomatoes, cereals, juice, eggs, apples and bananas, tea and coffee) and the staff was very helpful and nice. The towels were changed daily so I have no major complaints. If, when you come to Amsterdam, you want to stay (and admire) in your room this is not the best hotel, but if you come to the hotel only to shower and sleep - this is the best;) The easiest way to reach the hotel is by Connexion Bus 197 form the airport. You get off at Leidseplein and from there you enter Overtoom street and in 200m you are at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap sleep in the city”
Reviews.Author: SnowInBrussels
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam hotels are notoriously expensive so this is rare and good value for the money. On a direct tramline from the station and close to the city centre, bars and restaurants, above a grocery store, this is clean and feels safe and secure. If you have heavy bags/cases, note that there are 2 very steep flights of steps leading up to the entrance. Also if you're a light sleeper (eg coughing or creaking stairs would disturb you) you might want to bring earplugs. Buffet breakfast was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tone8906
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abba was very easy to find nearly being directly opposite a tram stop on Route 1. The hotel was really clean and tidy and the breakfast was buffet style with basic cereals, toast, cheese, ham, salami etc. It was certainly adequate to feed you up to last the day. The bathroom we had was shaired but this was only with one other room and it was right outside the room door so no problem at all. The room was a reasonable size with a nice balcony overlooking a quadrangle. For Amsterdam I thought it was great value for money being only 33 Euro a night for a twin room.

Reviews.Title: “3 days in Amsterdam, Abba is a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian0507
Reviews.Content: Got a double room with shared bathroom with a friend. I didn't realize the shared bathroom is basically one bathroom, shared with another room, which is this case was 3 guys. I thought it would be bigger with a few stalls and showers. But no. Even at least 2 of each would have been helpful, but then I guess they'd have to put all males and females in the sharing rooms. Made it a little hard to get in there to shower in the morning. We ran out of toilet paper the second day, fortunately my travel mate had a roll. We didn't leave it in there, don't know what those guys did. The bathroom got kind of gross by the second day or so, and the staff didn't really tidy it up and the paper was never refilled. Definitely remember shower shoes. The drain in the shower was slow. No wastebasket in there. The room itself was small but had what you needed. Not the cleanest but I've seen worse. Not too bad for the money. We faced out on the street. It was kind of noisy but really not too bad. You could hear the tram running but it wasn't a really populated area so not too much people noise. The tram flashes lights with the overhead cables sparking, so that might be a problem for some. My travel buddy mentioned this but it didn't bother me. The tram is right in front of the hotel so that is very convenient. Quick to get around in this city. It's great that this is above a little grocery. Very convenient, stop in and pick up some bottled water and snacks. Also, they put on a tiny surcharge for plastic water bottles for the deposit. It's like 50 cents. Cashier explained to me when I looked confused as to why it cost more than the sign on the shelf said. There's a machine towards the back of the store where you can bring back the empties and get your refund. It won't take crushed bottles though, as I found out. Breakfast is good, it's better to get there on the early side. Breads, sliced cheese and ham, boiled eggs, jams, cereal, coffee, juice. It's a small space when many people are trying to get food, and things run out, though the staff was very busily trying to keep up replacement. Staff pretty friendly, nice enough. It was a pretty good deal overall and if I went back to Amsterdam, I think I might stay here again if I didn't want to try out another section of town.

Reviews.Title: “Best Amsterdam budget hotel”
Reviews.Content: Tv in room, balcony, smoker friendly, really polite staff, great location next to vondelpark. 1min walk to Leidseplein, 3min walk to museums.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapest Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: chidem
Reviews.Content: We have been to Abba 3 times for now and never got disappointed. Being very close to Vondelpark and Leidseplein, you can never get bored in the area. There is a tram stop just in front of the hotel making other parts of the city easily accessable. Also, there is a supermarket next to the building and a 24 hour open store for alcohol across the road. The hotel is clean, breakfast is good. Yes, the stairs are steep but all in all it is a very good choice if you don't want to spend your money for a room in which you don't spend much time except for sleeping. Ideal for friend groups.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but nice”
Reviews.Author: Ruby2000
Reviews.Content: Positives-the room was large and the beds comfy. The price was excellent and included a very good free breakfast. The tram stops outside and it is near to Leidseplein and Museum area. Staff were friendly and helpful. Negatives - the street outside was very noisy, trams and traffic. You need earplugs. The pillows were lumpy and needed replacing.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable yet poor...”
Reviews.Author: isabel_msoares
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Abba for 4 nights... It was one of the cheapest options that I found in Amsterdam. Of course I didnÂ´t have great expectations about the place, but still it was disapointing. I had to carry my luggage through the stairs since they have no elevator. The room was not very clean, there were some bugs inside and sheets were dirty. On the second day they didnÂ´t even change our towels... and there was no toilet paper in the bathroom. When we were leaving for dinner we went to the reception and asked to put some toilet paper there. The answer was: "IÂ´m all by myself here now, so we will put some toilet paper tomorrow"... Location is good. Breakfast acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place especially for young people.”
Reviews.Author: IGBB
Reviews.Content: it's cheap, the staff is very helpful, the breakfast is nice, and the location is great especially for people who wants to party, 5 minutes walking from leidseplein. it's cheap and had everything i asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: lion27fly
Reviews.Content: Not so clean (sheets were a bit dirty). There was no light in the bathroom. Had to go down the stairs carrying my bag without any help. First time I had to use my own sheet in a hotel. This is not a hotel. It is quite a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jonny_Jager
Reviews.Content: We were very disheartened by the prices of Amsterdam hotels in general. However, having spent 4 nights at the Hotel Abba, we're wrapt to have found a very nice & clean place in a top location and at a very reasonable price given Amsterdam standards. The staff were very courteous and attentive, and very helpful when we tried to extend (and then unextend) our stay there. The room was very clean and complete with ensuite, and we were also surprised to learn that they offered a free breakfast as well. The location is great - just a short walk from Leidseplein, and also above a supermarket and ATM machine. There is also a tram stop right outside the front door, that leads to Centraal station. We were very happy with this find, and would not hesitate recommending this place to others looking for value for money accommodation in a city that isn't too cheap to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Decent accomodation for decent money”
Reviews.Author: Svibor
Reviews.Content: I was staying in this hotel in May 2011. Everything was great, madraces were great, everything was clean, stuff was pleasant and location is great, about 10-15 minutes of relax walking to the Dam square... I am coming back there next time for sure! Only thing missing is the internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Good value !!”
Reviews.Author: Marleybahia
Reviews.Content: We were 2 guys looking for a good place to sleep and a good location in amsterdam , and we found at Abba hotel, good breakfast (nothing special) above a market , in front to a bus and tram stop. so i think was enough for me ! but inside the room i just like the bed , but the room is clean and smell good.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: simran22
Reviews.Content: Staying here was the worst experience i had in my life i travel lot but this type of horrilbleexperience for me first time. Rudestaff ,terrible nightmare experience no humanity inside their hearts. Though i just want to getout of that place the movement i landed it will not be possible as they just fix you.since i dont want to start my holiday that way just kept my things and only in hotel when needed badly. Istead a bench on road would have been better choice as you will be a free bird.i dont want my fellow passengers to suffer the way i went through.Amsterdam is beautiful with lovely dutch people who are extreamly helpful, soft nice people in the country. But this ABBA hotel calls themselves dutch staff i afraid they have no single quality of dutch ..Asthe hotel SHOW ON NET THAT THE HOTEL FULL BUT NOT TRUE . THAT IS A SALES TRICK SO THAT PEOPLE THINK MUST BE GOOD HOTEL SO IT IS FULL AND FOOLS LIKE ME KEEP TRYING FOR I GOT IT AT ONE MONTH STRETCH.FOR ME TOO THEY SAID FULL BUT AVAILBLELIKE MOST ROOMS EMTY. ALL ARE NOT INNOCENT FOOLS LIKE ME TO GET STUCK AS I AM A LADY AND ASIAN SO THEY PLAYED THEIR CARDS,. OTHER PEOPLE WHO COME USE TO JUST FIND OTHER HOTEL AND MOVE.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising! In a good way”
Reviews.Author: danpb
Reviews.Content: Despite being a 1-star hotel, we were treated fairly good, no complaints at all in our whole stay. The stairs everybody talks about may seem a problem if you are under the effects of alcohol or maryjane, but we managed very well and didnt get injured. The stairs also smelled like humid & closed. Good overall experience

Reviews.Title: “Best service, great location”
Reviews.Author: mp1212
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abba was a pleasant surprise for me and my boyfriend who stayed there for four nights. The room was extremely bright and clean; we didn't even mind sharing the bathroom with the couple next door. It is a hostel, so people come and go mainly just to sleep, meaning the hotel stays quiet at all hours of the day. Breakfast is offered to all guests, and there's a good selection of breads and sandwich meats, tea, coffee, juices, cereal and fruit for the guests. Again, everything is clean, and the hotel staff does its best to make sure everything is as fresh as possible. I loved the location of this hotel. Though there isn't much in terms of restaurants or cafes right in the vicinity, there is an Albert-Heijin on the first floor of the hotel, which is excellent. It is also located right across the street from a tram station, which makes traveling simple and easy. The nightlife area, Leidseplein, is only a 10 minute walk away. All other locations are a quick tram right away as well. The best part of Hotel Abba would have to be its staff. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful, even giving advice and warnings about how much is too much to pay for certain items. My only complain? The steep and winding stairs are a bit tiring after a long day's walk, but nothing the average person cannot handle. I definitely plan on staying at Hotel Abba on future visits to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Its a hostel, not a hotel. For Amsterdam it was adequate but not central. The stairs were intense.”
Reviews.Author: RonaldFonjo
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in October 2010. 2 people. single room with bath. Clean but dormlike, not central, really steep stairs, friendly staff, free breakfast, pay wifi, uncomfortable bed, very sparce room. I was glad to find a place in Amsterdam for the price, but would have paid a little more had I known what it would be like here.

Reviews.Title: “if on a budget its a must”
Reviews.Author: christhehulk
Reviews.Content: to be honest more like a hostel but if your looking for somewhere cheap and clean to throw down your head look no further. staff were very friendly and helpful and breakfast was descent. lots of stairs but its amsterdam after all. very handy to transport with a tram stop (no.1) right outside. would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money for a no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: lunarJade
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced and clean. We stayed for two nights. Quiet for good night's rest - thanks to the reviews from other hotel guests ... we took their advice and asked for a room that faced the inner courtyard. Location - good and convenient. Walking distance to night life & shopping in Leidseplein area. Tram stops are right in front of Hotel Abba. There's a supermarket downstairs so it was convenient. Breakfast was simple but good - buffet style with good variety of breads, jams, ham, cheese, cut tomatoes/cucumber, cereals, fruits and eggs. Eat as much as you want and you can go without lunch and save a couple of Euros. The staircase are narrow and steep... just need to be extra careful when going up or down the stairs - not a big deal for us as we did not have huge luggage. The room we had has no windows, only a door to the balcony which you would obviously keep closed and locked when you go to bed... hence the room was quite stuffy. The bed was not as comfortable as I would like it - mattress was not firm enough. Overall, not bad for a budget hotel and surely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Location only redeeming quality”
Reviews.Author: Travelerfolk
Reviews.Content: Location is good, walking distance to all the sights, right on a tram to take to/from the train station and from there the airport and a nice grocery store underneath for convenience. Otherwise, it is marginally clean and they didn't clean our room or shared bath on the second day. Although they have three heavy, spring return doors to get into your room, the walls are thin and noise throughout the hotel can be heard in your room, Then there is the tram and crosswalk buzzer which only stops between 12:30 and 6:30 am. I remember distinctly. The personnel don't appear to be locals and rarely had a smile. Breakfast was adequate, but not served until 8am so if you have early travel plans forget about it and forget about a discount either. Did I mention the difficulty with the doors. Don't forget your key going to the bathroom, or block your door with a shoe, because between 12 and 7 am there is no personnel to help if you lock yourself out. One part of the hotel that was well built and installed were those spring returns. The beds were soft, internet cost 3 euro an hour, only two towels and some shower soap if they remember to refill the dispenser. One table, one chair, need a deposit for the TV remote, but there is one side table and a workable side closet for hanging stuff etc. I do not know the overall market in Amsterdam for hotels but this definitely did not seem like a good value. Maybe at half the price I would be happier, but at $100US a night I am not happy. I wish I had spent more or stayed in the suburbs.

Reviews.Title: “Suited down to the ground”
Reviews.Author: Magswhyte
Reviews.Content: Single, white, Irish, 22 year old female stayed late June 2010. Great hotel for the price, comfortable beds and the stairs aren't even that bad well the first and second flights are fine, not sure after that as my room was on the second floor. Request a balcony if you want to smoke happily in your room. Nice friendly staff, the tram stops literally outside the door and there's a grocery/munchie shop directly below the hotel, nice! Also held luggage until room/flight was ready. Would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and good location”
Reviews.Author: chloe-eloise
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abba was a great surprise, friendly staff and clean, secure rooms. The hotel is right outside tram stop from tram number one, very easy to get to. Great location near Vondelpark and bike rental right across the road. The rooms were basic, but clean and comfortable and very secure with three locked doors to get to your room. The hotel also offers a security box for a 10â‚¬ deposit just for that extra piece of mind. There is also a laundry available and breakfast included. The shared bathroom is only between two rooms, yours and your neighbour which made it feel much more like an ensuit. Overall we had a great stay at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: emilybean
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights and had no problems. The beds were a bit uncomfortable and one much moreso than the other (twin room). The included breakfast was simple but still among the best that I've had in a budget hotel. Toast, hardboiled eggs, coffee, juice, meats and cheeses, etc. The room was a bit small but had a balcony which was nice. My only complaint was that there are signs everywhere about not leaving food out due to pests. We did not but still had a couple of spider visitors and I don't believe spiders in particular are necessarily food-seeking. I actually woke up one night with a spider dancing on my face. So if you aren't a fan of spiders this may not be the place for you. But, in my opinion it was one small problem among an otherwise nice experience. This hotel is a bit out of the way. It's about a 15 min walk to the centre but Amsterdam is pretty walkable. There wasn't anything we couldn't walk to. Also, the hotel is directly above a grocery store which was convenient. The bathroom was shared, but in my situation only with 1 other room so it wasn't a problem. Someone mentioned towels below but we were always provided with towels. Also worth mentioning is that they had wifi for a fee but it did not work on an iPod touch and they mentioned that it never works on Blackberries/devices like this. The staff were quite nice and there was plenty of English channels on the TV. They also had a cat. This hotel had quite a personable/cozy atmosphere, mostly due to the staff. If I visit Amsterdam again, I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent clean basic hotel, but remember to bring some towels!!”
Reviews.Author: liver_bird_lfc
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed here for two nights earlier this month and overall it was fine. We found the hotel very easily as we got tram 1 from Central Station and it stops right outside the front door (the stop after Leidesplein). We had arrived early and hoped to leave our bags in their luggage room until our room was ready, but we were told it was and we could check in then (about 11am) rather than at 3pm, which was great. Our room (#77) was on the second floor and faced the courtyard so was nice and quiet. (Some overlook the main road at the front and are noisier.) It had two twin beds in it, and private ensuite facilities â€“ which was basically a small cupboard with a toilet and shower in it, plus a wash basin in the bedroom itself. The bathroom smelt quite damp but there was no sign of this â€“ it was all very clean, just a bit short of space if you need to get dressed in there! The only drawback was that no towels were provided. Had we known this, we would have brought some but there is no mention on the website or the site we booked through. Having paid far less in other cities and always had towels provided, it just hadnâ€™t crossed my mind that they didnâ€™t provide them. So partly my fault I guess, but I do think it would have been helpful to say somewhere. (Luckily we arrived early and could go shopping, but it would be awful if you arrived late at night and didnâ€™t have any! Even so, it wasnâ€™t something I had planned to spend my holiday money on!) The hotel is on the first, second and third floors of the building, and the stairs are very steep and curved, so you need to take care, especially if you have luggage to carry up (as thereâ€™s no lift). Having said that, I read about them on here beforehand and they werenâ€™t as bad as I expected! On the ground floor is an Albert Heijn supermarket, which was brilliant, especially the bakery. (We got things to take out for a packed lunch, and drinks for our room.) Breakfast is a typical continental affair served from 8-10am, but everything is fresh and kept well topped up so there is plenty for everyone. Itâ€™s self-service so you can have whatever you want. The breakfast room is bright and sunny with window boxes overlooking the street on the first floor. Also on the first floor is a lounge and smoking room. The resident cat also likes to sleep in that room, but sheâ€™s very friendly! It seems that most places in Amsterdam have a resident cat â€“ hotels, bars, coffeeshops*â€¦ - to help with any mouse problem I guess? (*They must have some of the most chilled cats in the world! ;o) ) There was also a TV in our room (although you have to pay a 10â‚¬ deposit for the remote control at reception if you want it â€“ it works fine without). The beds were nice and clean, really bouncy and comfy â€“ we slept soundly. We also had a private balcony with doors both to our room and further doors to the outside, which was handy when it rained. Even though it was May, it was quite cold but the radiators could be turned o/off as we needed â€“ which was great for drying our clothes overnight after we got soaked! The staff are helpful and friendly. There was a problem with their credit card machine so we had to pay cash, but there is a cash machine on the ground floor in the supermarket, and a bank just along the road. One evening I managed to lose the key to my case, but only realised this when I got back to my room. Luckily the finial on the end of the bed (bed post) came to my rescue and I managed to break the padlock with it!! So all in all, no major complaints at all. We had been surprised how expensive rooms are in Amsterdam, but given that, this seems pretty good value. Positives: Comfy beds, quiet rooms, good breakfast. Negatives: No towels â€“ or warning about this. Slightly weird shower head that spits water horizontally as well as vertically, but at least some water falls on you!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: dazednconfusedinOR
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Abba for 2 weeks in March. This is the second time I stayed here and also the only place I have ever stayed in Amsterdam so I have nothing to compare it with, but it is more than a good value. Hotel rooms in Amsterdam aren't cheap, however the rates at Hotel Abba are more than fair. I believe I paid 35 euros a night! It certainly isn't fancy, but a great place to crash after a wild day in the Dam. Way better than any hostel, that's for sure. Fairly quiet and a great location. A lot of people like to stay in the Centrum, but the area the hotel is in is pretty nice as well considering it is just a 5 minute walk to the popular Leidseplein area and about a 2 minute walk from Vondelpark. The street it's located on (Overtoom) is a major road so it's easy to access public transportation (tram line 1 stops literally right in front of the hotel). One complaint I here a lot is how steep the stairs are. No kidding?! It's Amsterdam - every place has incredibly steep and narrow stairs so if this is an issue for you (health-wise are just plain laziness) than you don't want to stay here as there is no elevator. The rooms are fairly small, but the do have a TV which is nice at the end of the day. The hotel also has rooms that face an inner courtyard (as opposed to facing the busy Overtoom street) so if you have a choice those rooms are more quiet. They also serve breakfast, which while very basic (bread, sliced meats and cheeses, juice, coffee, etc) is a nice touch as the same breakfast in Amsterdam would run at least $10 so over two weeks I probably saved over $100 easily. Staff is very friendly and helpful as well. The hotel is smoker friendly, which in Amsterdam means more than just cigarettes! To be honest, I never smelled marijuana once though. You are allowed to smoke in your room though, so if you're a prude who doesn't like people who smoke marijuana, than you might not want to stay here - be forewarned. They do ask you to open a window though so as not to set off the smoke detectors. The inner courtyard rooms do have a balcony though, so it's nice to sit out there and smoke a fatty. They do offer wireless Internet, but you have to pay. It was 3 euros an hour, or you could buy a 5 hour card. There isn't a whole heck of a lot of free wireless in Amsterdam. All in all, a great value for the money. Nice location, smoker friendly, breakfast included. Probably the only place I would stay while in the Dam.

Reviews.Title: “convenient cheap & clean”
Reviews.Author: LondonPaul
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend in January by myself and, whilst no luxury hotel, it was perfectly adequate for my needs, Convenient for the sights and museums and a direct tramride to the city centre, or about 25 mins walk to Dam Square. Albert Hein supremarket downstairs and useful little shops and restaurants around. Room was clean and warm (powerful adjustable radiator) and no problems with hot water, showers or toilet: although shared, always clean. Breakfast from 8-10 was standard Dutch fare (cheese, ham, boiled eggs etc) but plenty on offer and you really could fill up for the day ahead in a very light and confortable breakfast area. Staff were pleasant, fluent English of course, and available 24hrs. My single bad was lovely and comfy, but an extra pillow would have been nice. The room itself was small, just a bed, chair, basin and table but warm and light and airy The wardrobe was kind of built into the corner without a door, but it was all fine, clean and serviced every other day. Only downside was having a room by the staircase, so was woken each morning by people going to breakfast, but I am sure I could have been moved if I had asked, it just didn't matter that much! I have stayed in lots of Amsterdam hotels and this is perfectly fine in my opinion for the budget traveller, especially first time visitors who want to see the sights and have friendly staff on hand for help and advice.

Reviews.Title: “Good room and nice location”
Reviews.Author: faricas
Reviews.Content: Central location. Walking distance to many cultural and historic sites. We've got a Room in the top floor. Lots of stairs but a big room, clean and very quite. Breakfast is ok. Big Supermarket downstairs is a great plus.

Reviews.Title: “great place to pass out in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: teamosiena
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Amsterdam with my best friend. Looking for a place to pass out after museum-hopping and partying, and this was the perfect place. Not luxury by any means, but a great place to sleep! Comfortable bed and hot shower. Daniel at the front desk was awesome - got us into our room early, and gave us directions to a concert we had tickets for, and also to sites of interest such as the Mellow Yellow (best coffee shop we visited!). Lots of maps and info available at front desk. Great breakfast. After leaving Amsterdam I heard the Overtoom area is kind of seedy, but I never felt unsafe (& I'm a 5'2" female). Anyway, the Abba is great. Walking distance to Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh. Longer walk to Anne Frank House, but totally worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Low rates......high quality”
Reviews.Author: MIke133
Reviews.Content: Stayed here alone during a 3 day trip right before Christmas. If you don't want to read on, in short, this hotel is great. When I arrived in Amsterdam after an overnight flight from the USA, I was extremely tired and just wanted to rest in my hotel room. My arrival time, however, was pre-dawn and by the time I made my way to Hotel Abba it was only about 10am which was well before their check-in time of what I believe was 3pm. I went up anyway and asked if I could check-in early and the man at the desk was very accommodating, he checked to make sure my room was cleaned and then quickly got me inside. Room itself was very clean and though small and without en-suite bathrooms, it did have a hot and cold hand sink and opened out to a common balcony. Common bathroom and shower was clean and I never had a problem there. Hotel Abba does have a free breakfast every morning, but I never did end up going down and eating breakfast. Also, a grocery store entrance is located about 5 feet from the hotel's entrance which is very convenient if you don't want to go far (although there is other food on Overtoom) or the weather is bad. I walked throughout my stay in Amsterdam but I do know trams run up and down Overtoom and there is a stop right in front of the hotel. Abba is also one of the very few hotels in Amsterdam that still allows smoking, although fire alarms in the rooms are posted with a sign that claims a 1000 euro fine for setting it off (as I said before my room had a balcony you can go out on, but just opening the balcony doors a bit was sufficient to not set off alarms).

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice Before Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: jeamon
Reviews.Content: I realize this is a budget hotel but I've gotten great deals before without sacrificing basic quality. This hotel was disgusting. The rooms were tiny, I could touch both walls with my hands extended, and the walls were paperthin. I was put in between two couples travelling together and got very little sleep, even with earplugs. I could hear every word they said. I could also smell every joint they smoked - which was apparently at an hourly interval. I have no problem with people smoking pot but it was pervasive and constant. The only ventilation was achieved by opening my patio doors, which opened onto a common patio so it wasn't feasible for me, a solo female, to leave them open at night. Thus, despite the moderate temps outside, I slept in a very warm, pot-infused, noisy environment. Had it not been my first couple of nights after landing, I would not have slept at all. The breakfast was so-so. The management and other staff were not particularly helpful in that I was not offerred any assistance in climbing the crazy steep Amsterdam stairs with my luggage. The room was filthy - hair on the walls, debris on the floor, let's not even talk about the sheets. The common toilet and shower were slightly cleaner but not by much. I will never stay here again and will steer people clear of it when possible. So, if you're looking to save money, this might be for you, but I imagine there are better deals out there.

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain”
Reviews.Author: jonsan21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on a budget trip back in June 2007. Spent about 55 EUR per night for a single room with breakfast. I had to go through small stair case to reach the room.The room was small, carpeted, but 'quite' clean. There was a single bed, a cloth hanger, and that's it. The toilet is separated from the shower. I found different person everytime I went to the reception, but generally all were very helpfull. Nothing special with the breakfast, bread, butter, ham, cereal, etc - but since it's included in the room rate, it was OK. The location is a little bit out of the city center, although Amsterdam is not a big city. I had the "I Amsterdam" card, so travelling was not a problem. There's a tram stop just outside the hotel. I would recommend this hotel if you're travelling in a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ComfortseekerEngland
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to a twin room from the pe-booked single at no extra cost. Room just adequately furnished, but clean and warm. Staff friendly and helpful. Bathroom shared with one other room. No washbasin in room. Breakfast goodish - plenty but a bit unimaginative. A bit noisy because on a main tram route. Close to main museums, Vondel Park and Leidseplein.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, some difficulties”
Reviews.Author: rnathan
Reviews.Content: We were on the top floor, so we had to carry suitcases up four flights of steep stairs. The shared shower/toilet with one other room was a surprise. Otherwise, breakfast, service, welcome, advice and safe deposit box were very good. We chose the hotel because it was the only one with a reasonable price for our visit. As advertised, we had to pay by cash in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: oregonhiker6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in late May. We were on the next to the highest floor and the stairway is very steep. Located right at a tram stop so that is the best way to get to the hotel from the train station. The staff was very friendly. Breakfast was included. The room included a double bed, bed end tables, closet, table, 2 chairs and TV. The window looked out onto a courtyard. The bathroom included a sink, toilet and compact shower. The weather was warm and with the window open it was rather smokey during the evening. The hotel is within walking distance of many tourist sites and located right over a grocery store. We booked by email about 3 months prior to our stay and paid 85 Euro per night including breakfast. It was a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place for a group of 3!”
Reviews.Author: revproj
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late as I stayed at this hotel around the World cup in the summer of 2006. It was very hard to get a room at any hotel for a decent rate because of the world cup but managed to get a decent rate at the Abba for 3 people. I was a little skeptical at first as whoever was at the front desk did not appear too friendly but my friends and I got a decent rate for a room with 3 beds. When we went to our room we noticed in the closet that "Aqui robin" was written on the back which means "robbed here" in Spanish. After seeing this we very cautious in locking our stuff away but at the same time gave the hotel the benefit of the doubt. The room was moderately clean and comfortable and made for a decent stay overall for 3 young travelers. If you are looking for a fair priced place to crash after partying and in a good location then this is an alright place. It is right above a grocery store as well which is quite convenient if you are on a budget while traveling.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: cesareduardopinto
Reviews.Content: we liked.But,the rooms are small.WE stayed in 3th floor,there was many stairs.The breakfast is very good.The location is excellent.We recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Off the tourist track but has value”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: Due to a large convention in Amsterdam, I was unable to secure rooms for more than 1-2 nights at any hotel. I found the Hotel Abba through Booking.com. The hotel is near the Rijk Museum but not in the most favourable direction or location. Tram 1 from AMS Central Station runs right in front of the door â€“ a 10-15 minute tram ride depending on traffic. I was only able to get 1 night at this hotel, a price of 90 Euros for one room with 3 separate single beds. I had read that they take cash without discount and up charge to use a credit card â€“ so paid in cash at check in as requested. This room had a shared bath outside in the hall shared with one other guest room. The room was small given it was for 3 people â€“ and furnished very simply. The TV did work. The shared shower had no trays or shelves to hold any soap or shampoo. No toiletries were provided. The room was on the 3rd floor, and required use of 3 separate keys and rooms had to be double locked to ensure security. The view was of a busy street. Below the hotel is a large supermarket that occupies the first floor, which upon arrival was the scene of a fight involving 3-4 people. The windows are tight and keep out most noise, so I could not hear street traffic and shoppers from below with the windows closed. There is no air-conditioning or fan. The bed(s) were OK but not great. Breakfast is served in a room on the 2nd floor of the building (same floor as the hotel entrance). Breakfast included one type of cheese, one type of sliced meat, bread (no rolls), juice â€“ but there was none left for me), coffee, and no eggs or cereals were displayed. It was the most frugal and poorly provided breakfast I have experienced in my 20-30 stays in Holland. Hotel staff was affable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: softiegal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in November 2006. Pros: -Price was great -Clean Room -Good Location (right near tram stop) -Above a good supermarket -Comfy bed Cons: -Shower was small and yuck -Walking to our room up the stairs had a horrible smell everytime -No lift (hard to carry all our luggage upstairs) -Room was very basic I wouldn't stay here again in the future. If you can, spend a little more and stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go!!! (mouse...)”
Reviews.Author: marzia80
Reviews.Content: I booked 5 or six months before and I was expectant for my holiday in Amsterdam!!! Then I arrived there, I thought it's not so good but it's accetable....then during the first night I heard noises out of the window, I thought there was a man on the window sill so I slept with an eye opened....the noises continued and I said to my boyfriend to switch on the light..He looked outside but the noise became strongly from the basket trash!!! there was a mouse in that rotated whirling!!! We go downstairs (at 4 a.m.) and the man at the reception said "it's the middle of the night I cant hepl you, it can't kill you!!!" but a mouse has a lot of diseases and for a man they are very dangerous....the plague, the tifo, the toxoplasmosis, the elettrospirosis can be lethal... after 15 minutes of discussion, I said that I wouldn't have wanted to go upstair and I would have called the police if hehasn't made nothing so he said that he would have given back our money...We spend the rest of the night on the stairs until 8 o'clock then the reception opened and we went to another hotel...the fantastic Rho hotel....

Reviews.Title: “great location...”
Reviews.Author: AngieV
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abba is not bad if you don't mind sharing a bathroom or paying extra to have a bathroom in your room. It is in a very good location right of the Leidseplein and compared to most places to stay in Amsterdam it is very cheap. Just don't go with high expectations...Very friendly service. There isn't a lift so be prepared to haul all of your luggage up several flights of stairs (it's above a market) and there are also two or three keys for different doors before you get to your room...not bad for one or two nights, i wouldn't stay for an extended period of time...

Reviews.Title: “Overall good value”
Reviews.Author: Lalii
Reviews.Content: As a 22 year old first time traveller through europe i was pleasantly surprised with hotel Abba. We stayed at the same level of accommodation throughout europe and you never know what to expect but hotel Abba was simple with not much to complain about. Positives -the room size...booked a double but for some reason it was a triple and it was nice and spacious...a nice change as most budget accommodation = tiny rooms. -good location, close enough to walk to the center but not too close that you feel everything's on top of you. -tram stop right outside -nice area with food stores and bakeries nearby -comfy beds and pillows (which we found is not a given in budget places) -we had quite a large bathroom negatives- our room faced the street, was cool except when you wanted to open the window at night which let in quite a bit of noise. (when windows were closed was fine) -the stairs were steep but really not a big issue overall i felt it was basic in a nice way - not much can be wrong :P would deff stay there again

Reviews.Title: “really fine budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: singlegaymale
Reviews.Content: i'm here right now for 4 night stay in a basic single room, toilet and shower down the hall, access never a problem. It's room 3, and has floor to ceiling glass doors leading to a shared balcony that overlooks an interior courtyard. it has been very quiet despite being fully booked (neighbors are quiet.) breakfast is fine, the typical dutch breakfast, and the woman who sets it out does a great job keeping everything replenished. yes, the stairs are steep, but not the steepest i've seen here. overall, i'd recommend this hotel, and would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “fine for budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Jamesies
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abba is fine if all your looking for is budget accommodation and somewhere to put your bags and sleep. The good points about this hotel is that it is in a good location next to the train line, on top of a supermarket and not too far from the action (but far enough to get away from the action if you want). The staff were friendly and helpful and you get a free basic brekkie. However there were bad points as well. My group were by no means unfit but getting to our room on the top level with our backpacks on was like running a marathon! The stairs are like a ladder and never ending and I wouldnt want to be too intoxicated whilst going up them thats for sure! Our rooms at the top were like an oven - avoid them if at all possible as outside it didnt really seem that hot (but we are from Australia so probably have a high tolerance to the heat!) so I would hate to have them in a heatwave. Be aware that it is a smoke friendly hotel which didnt bother us but might some people. If we were to go back to Amsterdam, we would probably spend the money to stay somewhere else, and I wouldnt take the kids there, but as I said at the start, if your looking for somewhere budget to stay, which the Abba was one of the cheapest places I found in Amsterdam, this place would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: tumblingweed
Reviews.Content: Solo female traveler, stayed here for 4 nights late April. Extremely nice gentleman at reception who provided me with helpful tips on sightseeing. As previously mentioned, tram stop right out front and 5 minute walk (if that) to Leidseplein, 10 minute walk to museum district, many affordable eating options stone's throw distance, nice fairly quiet neighborhood. Room was spotlessly clean, appx. 8x12 feet, french door open to small balcony (shared) which made room seem larger, sink in room, toilet & shower few steps down hall. Never had to wait for facilities, so not many rooms sharing, also kept clean. Had 2 keys for access. Could hear those in room next to me a bit, mostly just coming and going but was fortunate to have quiet neighbors. Was a real treat to be able to smoke in room after being on feet sightseeing all day, relief to open balcony door, put feet up and relax a bit before turning in. Breakfast adequate quality, quite a few choices, liked that it was offered early, room (actually 2 rooms) bright and cheerful. Left my umbrella in breakfast room one morning and found it returned to room that night. I rate this place excellent for the price because of outstanding staff and cleanliness!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, but avoid if you don't like the smell of weed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a one night, budget trip to Amsterdam. Overall we thought it to be good value for money. GOOD POINTS Very good accomodation for what you pay for Really lovely, friendly staff Great breakfast, excellent coffee Excellent location - you can walk into the centre, or there is a tram stop right outside Handy supermarket underneath Very secure BAD POINTS Steep stairs (not really a problem for us, but can see how it could be for others) You need three keys to get into your room (a little inconvienient, but makes you feel safe) There was a little bit of mould in our bathroom, but not loads - all above eye level The biggest problem for us was that management allow weed to be smoked in the hotel, and as we were unlucky enough to have neigbours who stayed in all day and smoked, it really did smell very strongly of weed. I think maybe we were just unlucky, but it did spoil our stay a bit. WOULD I STAY AGAIN? For another quick budget stopover, yes. For longer than that, or if I had kids with me, no way.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, a little rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: mariamargarita
Reviews.Content: The Abba is not kidding: it is a BUDGET hotel. That means that if you get a double, that means your twin beds will be pushed together. If youre travelling with a significant other, I suggest being careful you dont fall through the crack in the middle of the beds! The sheets are all sewn together and the whole place has an air of being cheap. But, really, for the price (65 Euro a night for a double), it wasnt that bad. We only shared a bathroom with one other room, the hotel was close to the Leidseplein & a very short walk from the Center of Amsterdam. You can take the 1 or 6 tram from Central Station or if youre really ambitious, you can even walk. The front desk was friendly & while the stairs were defenitely a killer, it didnt have an endless party atmosphere. I should mention that the supermarket the Abba lives above closes at the unheard of hour of 800pm. As Americans used to 24 hour everything, this was a bit jarring. Luckily there was a night shop across the street & an awesome Dutch automaat around the corner for cheap beer & kaasouffle. My only big gripe with the Abba was that they only took cash. Fortunately, there is an ATM right by the hotel so you dont have to walk around Amsterdam with a wad of cash. All in all, a decent one star.

Reviews.Title: “Great low budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olli85
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the central station and went into the the tourist information center. They recommended the hotel and booked it for us. 30 minutes later, we were in the hotel room. Small stairs like in many houses of amsterdam. Very clean rooms. Very good situated in the center of amsterdam. Very friendly staff. Small but good breakfast buffet. Tram station next to the hotel. Leidseplaan with many bars is only a walk of 5 min away. Supermarket immediately next to the hotel. All in all a very nice and cheap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good & bad things about Abba Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've spent 3 nights at Hotel Abba in January 2006. It was our 6-7th visit in Amsterdam, but first in this hotel. There were some things that we liked but unfortunately the majority of things we didn't like. Obviously, the positive thing was the price. The breakfast was also okey (the same as in any other hotel). TV set in the room was also an advantage. The location of the hotel was also quite good - it's not the strict city center itself but you can get almost anywhere on foot in a short time. Now the negative sides of Abba Hotel. The main problem was the walls: they were so thin that you could virtually hear what the neighbors were wispering. And if you'll have so much bad luck as we had, i.e. having very noisy neighbors, it'd be even impossible to sleep. Next thing - keys. To get to your room you need 3 keys. It is good for security reasons but there was a constant problem with opening the doors, the keys were getting stuck all the time. And after several attempts to get them out it started to be quite frustrating. Another problem: bathroom. It was a shared bathroom (for 2 rooms)& leaving aside a huge fungi on the ceiling, there was a patch of pubic hair on the tiles uncleaned for the entire time we've spent in that hotel!!! Last but not least, to get to the breakfast room, you had to go out on the street and go there using another entrance to the hotel. NOT pleasant in winter time. Forget about going to breakfast in your sleepers!

Reviews.Title: “fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Abba Hotel in April 05. It was a great place to stay, friendly staff, clean, reasonable rates, and right off the #1 tram line. I will be staying there again this Spring.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend at the Abba. Easy access to and from Central Station (E1.80 single, tram stop No 1 just outside hotel. The hotel is ok, basic but clean with lots of stairs. The reception staff are very helpful. I was impressed with the security, different keys for access to stairs, corridors and rooms. Breakfast is standard continental, lots of it. If you dont want to eat/drink downtown, it only takes 3 minutes walk to get to Leidseplein, and about 10 minutes walk to the Van Gough museum.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well situated and excellent for the tram as there is a tram stop outside the entrance to the hotel that goes directly to the train station. Also a late night convenience shop opposite as well which was useful for bottles of water and snacks. Friendly staff. Be prepared to carry your case up very steep & narrow stairs (I was on the top floor by the last day of my holiday I felt pretty healthy with all the exercise). The rooms are basic but clean and towels where changed everyday. I felt for the money (55 Euros a night for a twin room with private bathroom) the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a one star hotel Abba is excellent! Our room was clean and the staff was very friendly & helpful. This was exactly what my girlfriend and I were looking for. Even the location was better than we expected, half an hour walk to the train station, but only a few minutes from Leidse Plein and the best shopping areas. Only minuses came from the fire alarm accidentally going off one night (someone forgot to open the window while smoking weed;) and from the staff only giving us one fresh towel the second day (they fixed the mistake right away). Would definitely recommend Hotel Abba to all young Dam -visitors!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dip86
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Abba Hotel with two friends for 3 nights. I have to say I have not got one complaint, the hotel was quite near to the nightlife bars etc... but not in the centre of the City. The number one tram will take you from central station to the hotel and stops right outside the hotel so very handy, it would be approx. a 20min walk to Dam Square from the Hotel so it's really not that far out. The rooms were basic but very clean and comfortable. There is a supermarket below the hotel and a late shop just across the road which can be handy. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for a week in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: littleApfel
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at Hotel Abba. For the price we payed, the hotel was more than we expected. Breakfast every morning was delicious - toast, meat, cheese, eggs, cereal, coffee, tea and orange juice. The staff was exteremely friendly and made our stay in Amsterdam very enjoyable. The location was fantastic - near Vondelpark and Museum Quarter. Close to the center of Amsterdam, but not in a loud neighborhood. Certainly not a 'ghetto' as another reviewer stated, simply a city neighborhood. We never saw any mice or mousetraps for that matter. Yes the stairs are steep, but they also were very steep in the other hotels we stayed in, in the Netherlands. One thing to watch out for - the television. We had trouble leaving in the morning because we would get sucked into European MTV - a dangerous endeavor.

Reviews.Title: “abba wasnt that bad”
Reviews.Author: yellowsnider
Reviews.Content: after staying 4 nights at the flying pig hostel down town(that was a dump) this place was awsome. sure there were mice but i didnt mind they only came out at night. there was a bar downstairs and the staff was really nice.in fact when i go back july 2005 ill stay here. i ended up paying only $5 more then the hostel and i got my own bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely helpful at Abba. As with every place in Amsterdam, we had to deal with steep curving stairs. We had to share a bathroom with the neighbors as well as the balcony. Interesting view into private apartments from the balcony. It was worth the price, due to location, cleanliness, breakfast, and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “great cheap accomadition”
Reviews.Author: stef58
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great if your looking cheap accomadation. hotel was very clean but basic. tv had quite a few sky channels and the breakfast was on self serve basis, cereal, toast, meat and cheese. staff where very friendly and helpful. would recommed to anybody looking cheap but cheerful accomadition. handy to leidsplein with a tram stop right outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Abba in November of 2001. Good location outside of the city center yet close to museums and entertainment. Check out The Noon coffeeshop nearby. My single room was small but the bed was comfy and there was a TV with CNN in english. Staff was friendly and room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but just what we wanted - "crackin'"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of student mates stayed at the Abba in'dam back in January '02. Once we had negotiated the steep stairs with liquid running down them we were surprised to find a spacious room with are own private bathroom! The staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly, especially Flangelena Von Fanny Van Flange. Although breakfast was offered the four of us never quite managed to get up in time to sample the delights! Ideally situated and only a 2 minutes walk from a 24 hour photocopying facility!! Really useful for us students....? For what we paid we couldn't have asked for any more! We even wrote a song:Hotel Abba Budget Price (in the tune of Hotel California, by The Eagles)Living it up at the Hotel Abba Budget Price what a total disgrace, there's mice all over the place Living it up at the Hotel Abba Budget Price such a s*** place, you'll offend your mates...copyright mcgOnly kidding it's a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Abba”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel better than average for the price...good breakfast....fair staff.....nice location...tram out front...walk to nightlife...sr

Reviews.Title: “Abba - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: tootsielass
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Abba twice and have had no complaints. It's great due to the fact that it is cheap, clean, breakfast is what you would expect for Amsterdam, on a main tram route and handy for everything. Anyone that complains shouldn't be staying in a budget hotel they should be digging deep and paying for what they actually want from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a nice part of amsterdam,easy to get a tram to any part of the city.Rooms were clean mine was on the top floor. Very good for a budget hotel.Does not look much from outside but staff were great and rooms were nice with TV.
